$comment: Static content - This section contains general safety rules and procedures that do not change from site to site
description: Static safety rules and procedures applicable to all JSB sites

section_5_general_safety.title: 5. GENERAL SAFETY
rules: All personnel on site shall comply with the requirements of Occupational Health and Safety and Environmental Legislation.
All subcontractors, suppliers and their personnel shall comply with Procedures for Subcontractors and Suppliers as attached to the subcontract documents/purchase order.
No subcontractor or their personnel shall commence work on site without being inducted by the site manager including reading, signing and returning a copy of this document.

It is each subcontractor's responsibility to ensure all their employees have been fully trained in and comply with all aspects of their Safe Work Method Statement (JSA or equivalent) submitted to James Samuels Builder, including waste avoidance initiatives.

Any accident (no matter how minor), dangerous occurrence (near miss) or safety hazard must be reported to the Site Manager as soon as possible. If a Serious Accident has occurred or dangerous occurrence which could have endangered life you must not disturb an area within 4m of the accident scene except to assist any injured person. You must also not use, move or interfere with plant if it has been involved in the accident/incident. Alert the Site Manager as soon as possible.
Any Environmental Incident, i.e. spillage (no matter how minor), or dangerous occurrence, etc. must be reported to the Site Manager as soon as possible.
Any complaint by the Building Owner, the public or other shall be referred to the Site Manager.

All workers on site must be adequately trained to do their job and have undertaken General Industry Induction Training. Personnel should not attempt any unfamiliar work without instruction. Do not attempt tasks beyond your physical strength. Ask for assistance.

Safety and Environmental inspections of the site shall be carried out on a regular basis and any areas of non compliance must be rectified as soon as possible or immediately if there is an imminent risk to anyone's personal safety or risk to the environment.

section_6_electrical_safety.title: 6. ELECTRICAL SAFETY
rules: All electrical wiring on site must be treated as live.
Only site electricians are to cut electrical wires and only after testing the wire with a suitable testing device to confirm it is not live.
No work is to commence on site until the Site Manager has confirmed an Electrical Safety Survey and Protection Procedures have been completed.
All power and lighting circuits must be protected by Residual Current Devices and RCD's must be tested in accordance with regulations in your State or Territory.
Wherever a circuit is to be isolated the circuit breaker or RCD is to be locked in the off position by means of a lockout device (with key lock) or the door of the switchboard must be locked.
All extension leads and electrical equipment shall be tested and have an up to date tag attached.
Temporary lighting shall be securely mounted and protected by wire guards or similar.
section_6_electrical_safety.note: Note: Any breaches of the above will be considered extremely serious and those involved may be asked to leave the site and not return.

section_7_working_at_height.title: 7. WORKING AT HEIGHT

rules.text: When working at height where no other protection is available, wear a safety harness fixed to an appropriate anchorage point.

sub_rules: Never climb higher than the 3rd rung from the top.
Always have 3 limbs on the ladder at all times, i.e. 2 feet & 1 hand or 2 hands & 1 foot.
Always work within easy arm's reach from the ladder.

rules.text: In all circumstances ladders and scaffold used in the performance of the works shall:
sub_rules: Comply to and be used in accordance with the legislation, Australian Standards and the manufacturer's recommendations.
Be in good condition with the load bearing capacity displayed at access points.
Be of commercial or electrical grade as appropriate.

section_7_working_at_height.note: Note: No domestic grade ladders will be allowed on this site.

section_9_hazardous_substances.title: 9. HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES
rules: Containers for any substance must be labelled.
Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) must be provided to James Samuels Builder for any hazardous substance brought onto the site.
All requirements of Material Safety Data Sheets must be complied with including the wearing of appropriate PPE.

The law requires a register of hazardous substances to be kept and a risk assessment be carried out on all hazardous substances Synthetic Mineral Fibre (SMF) material must be stored in designated areas, in containers or under cover sheets. All work involving materials containing SMFs shall comply with the WorkSafe Code of Practice. Any cutting of MDF on site must be carried out in a designated cutting room which shall be adequately ventilated. An appropriate dusk mask must be worn when cutting.

section_10_plant_equipment.title: 10. PLANT, EQUIPMENT AND POWER TOOLS
rules: Do not use machinery, power tools or other equipment without adequate and effective guards.
Take care when using explosive power tools. Always use suitable eye and ear protection and display a warning sign when using these tools.

sub_rules: Only be operated by trained and if required certified personnel wearing appropriate PPE. Please provide details of your Certificate of Competency on the last page, i.e. the sign-off page of this induction form.
Be fit for purpose and properly maintained in accordance with legislation, Australian Standards and manufacturers recommendations.
Not be brought onto the site unless there is evidence of inspection and/or maintenance records.

section_11_ppe_rules.title: 11. PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE)
rules: Appropriate PPE must be used as detailed in the Safe Work Method Statements (JSA or equivalent) submitted to James Samuels Builder
PPE advisory signs must be displayed where PPE is required to be worn.
Steel capped safety footwear must be worn on site at all times.
section_11_ppe_rules.note: Note: Site-specific conditions for when PPE is required are provided in the site-specific data file.

section_13_general.title: 13. GENERAL
rules: No existing Building Services shall be altered without the approval of the Building Manager/ Owner. This process will be coordinated by the Site Manager.
Any upgrade of documentation shall be provided at the weekly Subcontractor Site Meeting Subcontractors are to remove all redundant documentation from site immediately.

section_15_waste_management_rules.title: 15. WASTE MANAGEMENT
section_15_waste_management_rules.note: Note: It is a James Samuels Builder objective to avoid, whenever possible, the generation of waste and to recycle a minimum of 60% of all waste generated on site, thus achieving up to 60% reduction/avoidance in waste to landfill.

options: Waste sorted into separate bins for recycling or disposal (preferred)
All waste placed in common bins and sorted by Waste Removal Contractor
waste_disposal_strategy.note: Note: Waste streams must not be contaminated, eg., food scraps with recycled cardboard.

notes: Note: All contractors must remove their own waste.
Note: Records of quantities recycled, sent to landfill or other must be passed onto the Project Manager.

section_16_paint_rules.title: 16. STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF PAINT AND ASSOCIATED WASTES

rules: Selection of low emission or low off-gassing paint to minimise impact on indoor air quality should be a priority. Depending on paint selected, work practices may need to be modified, e.g. oil based enamel finishes applied off site.

requirements: Secure/lockable area where paints can be stored without risk of vandalism, theft or damage.
In the case of enamel paints and thinners, a fire extinguisher is to be stored at the entry point to the storage area.
The storage area is to be well ventilated.
paint_storage_rules.note: Note: Site-specific storage procedures are provided in the site-specific data file.

rules: Paint, turps, thinners, etc shall not be tipped into stormwater drains or sinks, basins, toilets, etc, i.e. the sewerage system.
Paint brushes, rollers, trays, etc. shall not be washed so as washout water enters the sewerage or stormwater drainage systems.
All washout water and waste paint shall be retained and removed from site.

rules.text: The painting subcontractor shall provide the following facilities (as a minimum) for paint washout:
facilities: Water and recycled water storage (approx 10 litres)
Enamel paint filter and recycled turpentine storage.
Paint residue and clean out wastes.
Empty drum storage for return to the manufacturer.

paint_washout_rules.note: Note: Site-specific washout procedures are provided in the site-specific data file. Note: Records of waste disposal must be passed onto the Project Manager.

section_17_air_quality_rules.title: 17. AIR QUALITY AND NOISE MANAGEMENT
rules: Wherever possible low off-gassing paints and water-based glues will be used on this site.

rules.text: Other precautions relating to air quality are as follows:
precautions: All work creating dust must be carried out in a contained environment
Dust extraction/ Vacs must be used on all machinery

section_17_air_quality_rules.note: Note: Site-specific noisy works times and precautions are provided in the site-specific data file.

section_18_stormwater_rules.title: 18. STORMWATER, SEDIMENTATION AND CONCRETE WASTE MANAGEMENT
rules: If concrete pumping or the refuelling of plant is to take place on site, special pollution prevention precautions must be undertaken by the relevant subcontractor. Concrete pumping or refuelling shall only be permitted in a bunded area protected by an appropriate impervious ground sheet.
Waste concrete shall be poured on to a suitable membrane, broken up and removed to a waste bin after concrete has set.
Concrete wash downs will not be permitted on site. Concrete truck "washout" will take place at the concrete supplier's facility.
section_18_stormwater_rules.note: Note: Site-specific additional precautions are provided in the site-specific data file.

section_19_habitat_rules.title: 19. HABITAT AND CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT
section_19_habitat_rules.note: Note: Site-specific precautions relating to the protection of flora/fauna are provided in the site-specific data file.

section_22_amenities_rules.title: 22. AMENITIES, HOUSEKEEPING AND BEHAVIOUR
rules: There is no smoking within the building or building surrounds.
Drugs and alcohol are banned from site.
Persons under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol will not be permitted on site.
Radios shall be permitted on site. If radios are permitted on site they are to be played at reasonable volume levels.
Offensive language is not to be used on site. Remember other parts of the building may well be still occupied
Sexual Harassment or harassment of any nature shall not be tolerated on site. If this occurs it should be reported to the Site Manager.
Noise, dirt and dust control are the responsibilities of each subcontractor.
It is each subcontractors responsibility to progressively clean up their rubbish and remove it to designated area/bins.
section_22_amenities_rules.note: Note: Site-specific amenities locations, parking, toilets, and noisy works hours are provided in the site-specific data file.

evacuation_procedure.title: 4. EMERGENCY AND EVACUATION - Standard Procedure
rules: All workers on site are to follow all emergency and evacuation procedures as directed by the Building Fire Wardens and/or Building Manager.

sub_rules: All workers on site are to leave the site via the front of the block on Crown Street.
Site Manager is to ensure the site is clear taking Site Diary with them (if possible)
All personnel are to evacuate to assembly area located directly opposite the site on Crown St
Do not re-enter the Site until advised by the emergency authority.

rules: In the case of an environmental emergency, immediately contact the Site/Project Manager and follow their directions. If the Site/Project Manager is not available please contact the Fire Brigade (000) or the EPA/Local Government Authority.
evacuation_procedure.note: Note: Site-specific emergency contacts are provided in the site-specific data file.
